intro: Psoralea bolusii, commonly known as the Bolus psoralea, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and trifoliate leaves, which are typical of many leguminous species. It produces small, lens-shaped pods that contain several seeds. Psoralea bolusii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
